diff_analysis.evidence: The new resolve_locale_filename and load functions in babel/localedata.py use os.path.basename(name) to strip directory components but still accept arbitrary filenames and only check for Windows reserved names. This can allow an attacker controlling the locale name to reference unintended .dat files within the locale-data directory (e.g., using crafted names to target specific files), constituting an improper limitation of pathname (path traversal within the application’s data directory).
